intro: Epilobium × eliasii var. adnatiformis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved willow herb, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, willow-like stems and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with four petals, typically in shades of pink or white. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as stream banks and woodland edges. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological restoration and wetland habitats.
